quotes.quote: A superior man is modest in his speech, but exceeds in his actions.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Ability will never catch up with the demand for it.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: An oppressive government is more to be feared than a tiger.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Be not ashamed of mistakes and thus make them crimes.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Before you embark on a journey of revenge, dig two graves.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Better a diamond with a flaw than a pebble without.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: By nature, men are nearly alike; by practice, they get to be wide apart.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Death and life have their determined appointments; riches and honors depend upon heaven.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Do not impose on others what you yourself do not desire.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Faced with what is right, to leave it undone shows a lack of courage.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Fine words and an insinuating appearance are seldom associated with true virtue.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Forget injuries, never forget kindnesses.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Go before the people with your example, and be laborious in their affairs.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Have no friends not equal to yourself.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: He who exercises government by means of his virtue may be compared to the north polar star, which keeps its place and all the stars turn towards it.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: He who learns but does not think, is lost! He who thinks but does not learn is in great danger.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: He who speaks without modesty will find it difficult to make his words good.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: He who will not economize will have to agonize.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: He with whom neither slander that gradually soaks into the mind, nor statements that startle like a wound in the flesh, are successful may be called intelligent indeed.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Heaven means to be one with God.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Hold faithfulness and sincerity as first principles.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: I am not one who was born in the possession of knowledge; I am one who is fond of antiquity, and earnest in seeking it there.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: I have not seen a person who loved virtue, or one who hated what was not virtuous. He who loved virtue would esteem nothing above it.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: I hear, I know. I see, I remember. I do, I understand.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: I want you to be everything that's you, deep at the center of your being.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: I will not be concerned at other men's not knowing me;I will be concerned at my own want of ability.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: If a man takes no thought about what is distant, he will find sorrow near at hand.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: If a man withdraws his mind from the love of beauty, and applies it as sincerely to the love of the virtuous; if, in serving his parents, he can exert his utmost strength; if, in serving his prince, he can devote his life; if in his intercourse with his friends, his words are sincere - although men say that he has not learned, I will certainly say that he has.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: If I am walking with two other men, each of them will serve as my teacher. I will pick out the good points of the one and imitate them, and the bad points of the other and correct them in myself.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: If we don't know life, how can we know death?
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: If you look into your own heart, and you find nothing wrong there, what is there to worry about? What is there to fear?
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: If you think in terms of a year, plant a seed; if in terms of ten years, plant trees; if in terms of 100 years, teach the people.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Ignorance is the night of the mind, but a night without moon and star.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: In a country well governed, poverty is something to be ashamed of. In a country badly governed, wealth is something to be ashamed of.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Instead of being concerned that you have no office, be concerned to think how you may fit yourself for office. Instead of being concerned that you are not known, seek to be worthy of being known.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Is virtue a thing remote? I wish to be virtuous, and lo! Virtue is at hand.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: It is easy to hate and it is difficult to love. This is how the whole scheme of things works. All good things are difficult to achieve; and bad things are very easy to get.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: It is more shameful to distrust our friends than to be deceived by them.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Learning without thought is labor lost; thought without learning is perilous.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Look at the means which a man employs, consider his motives, observe his pleasures. A man simply cannot conceal himself!
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Men's natures are alike, it is their habits that carry them far apart.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Never contract friendship with a man that is not better than thyself.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Never give a sword to a man who can't dance.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Old age, believe me, is a good and pleasant thing. It is true you are gently shouldered off the stage, but then you are given such a comfortable front stall as spectator.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Only the wisest and stupidest of men never change.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in getting up every time we do.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Real knowledge is to know the extent of one's ignorance.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Recompense injury with justice, and recompense kindness with kindness.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Respect yourself and others will respect you.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Silence is a true friend who never betrays.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Speak the truth, do not yield to anger; give, if thou art asked for little; by these three steps thou wilt go near the gods.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Study the past if you would define the future.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Study the past, if you would divine the future.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Success depends upon previous preparation, and without such preparation there is sure to be failure.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The book salesman should be honored because he brings to our attention, as a rule, the very books we need most and neglect most.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The cautious seldom err.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The determined scholar and the man of virtue will not seek to live at the expense of injuring their virtue. They will even sacrifice their lives to preserve their virtue complete.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The expectations of life depend upon diligence; the mechanic that would perfect his work must first sharpen his tools.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The faults of a superior person are like the sun and moon. They have their faults, and everyone sees them; they change and everyone looks up to them.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The firm, the enduring, the simple, and the modest are near to virtue.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The man of virtue makes the difficulty to be overcome his first business, and success only a subsequent consideration.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The man who in view of gain thinks of righteousness; who in the view of danger is prepared to give up his life; and who does not forget an old agreement however far back it extends - such a man may be reckoned a complete man.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The more man meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The object of the superior man is truth.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The people may be made to follow a path of action, but they may not be made to understand it.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The scholar who cherishes the love of comfort is not fit to be deemed a scholar.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The strength of a nation derives from the integrity of the home.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The superior man acts before he speaks, and afterwards speaks according to his action.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The superior man cannot be known in little matters, but he may be entrusted with great concerns. The small man may not be entrusted with great concerns, but he may be known in little matters.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The superior man is distressed by the limitations of his ability; he is not distressed by the fact that men do not recognize the ability that he has.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The superior man is modest in his speech, but exceeds in his actions.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The superior man is satisfied and composed; the mean man is always full of distress.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The superior man makes the difficulty to be overcome his first interest; success only comes later.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The superior man thinks always of virtue; the common man thinks of comfort.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The superior man understands what is right; the inferior man understands what will sell.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The superior man, when resting in safety, does not forget that danger may come. When in a state of security he does not forget the possibility of ruin. When all is orderly, he does not forget that disorder may come. Thus his person is not endangered, and his States and all their clans are preserved.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The superior man...does not set his mind either for anything, or against anything; what is right he will follow.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: The will to win, the desire to succeed, the urge to reach your full potential... these are the keys that will unlock the door to personal excellence.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: There are three methods to gaining wisdom. The first is reflection, which is the highest. The second is limitation, which is the easiest. The third is experience, which is the bitterest.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: There are three things which the superior man guards against. In youth...lust. When he is strong...quarrelsomeness. When he is old...covetousness.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: They must often change who would be constant in happiness or wisdom.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Things that are done, it is needless to speak about...things that are past, it is needless to blame.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: To be able to practice five things everywhere under heaven constitutes perfect virtue...[They are] gravity, generosity of soul, sincerity, earnestness, and kindness.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: To be able under all circumstances to practice five things constitutes perfect virtue; these five things are gravity, generosity of soul, sincerity, earnestness and kindness.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: To be wronged is nothing unless you continue to remember it.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: To go beyond is as wrong as to fall short.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: To practice five things under all circumstances constitutes perfect virtue; these five are gravity, generosity of soul, sincerity, earnestness, and kindness.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: To see and listen to the wicked is already the beginning of wickedness.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: To see the right and not to do it is cowardice.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: To see what is right, and not to do it, is want of courage or of principle.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Virtue is more to man than either water or fire. I have seen men die from treading on water and fire, but I have never seen a man die from treading the course of virtue.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Virtue is not left to stand alone. He who practices it will have neighbors.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Virtuous people often revenge themselves for the constraints to which they submit by the boredom which they inspire.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: We should feel sorrow, but not sink under its oppression.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: What the superior man seeks is in himself; what the small man seeks is in others.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: What you do not want done to yourself, do not do to others.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: When a man's knowledge is sufficient to attain, and his virtue is not sufficient to enable him to hold, whatever he may have gained, he will lose again.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: When anger rises, think of the consequences.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: When it is obvious that the goals cannot be reached, don't adjust the goals, adjust the action steps.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: When we see men of a contrary character, we should turn inwards and examine ourselves.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: When we see men of worth, we should think of equaling them; when we see men of a contrary character, we should turn inwards and examine ourselves.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: When we see persons of worth, we should think of equaling them; when we see persons of a contrary character, we should turn inwards and examine ourselves.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: When you are laboring for others let it be with the same zeal as if it were for yourself.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: When you have faults, do not fear to abandon them.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: When you know a thing, to hold that you know it, and when you do not know a thing, to allow that you do not know it - this is knowledge.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Wheresoever you go, go with all your heart.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: While you are not able to serve men, how can you serve spirits of the dead?...While you do not know life, how can you know about death?
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Wisdom, compassion, and courage are the three universally recognized moral qualities of men.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: With coarse rice to eat, with water to drink, and my bended arm for a pillow - I have still joy in the midst of these things. Riches and honors acquired by unrighteousness are to me as a floating cloud.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Without an acquaintance with the rules of propriety, it is impossible for the character to be established.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: Without feelings of respect, what is there to distinguish men from beasts?
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: You cannot open a book without learning something.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.quote: It is enough that the people know there was an election. The people who cast the votes decide nothing. The people who count the votes decide everything.
quotes.name: Stalin

quotes.quote: Ideas are more powerful than guns. We would not let our enemies have guns, why should we let them have ideas.
quotes.name: Stalin

quotes.quote: Death is the solution to all problems. No man - no problem.
quotes.name: Stalin

quotes.quote: Education is a weapon, whose effect depends on who holds it in his hands and at whom it is aimed.
quotes.name: Stalin

quotes.quote: The Pope! How many divisions has he got ?
quotes.name: Stalin

quotes.quote: Gratitude is a sickness suffered by dogs.
quotes.name: Stalin

quotes.quote: In the Soviet army it takes more courage to retreat than advance.
quotes.name: Stalin

quotes.quote: History shows that there are no invincible armies.
quotes.name: Stalin

quotes.quote: The writer is the engineer of the human soul.
quotes.name: Stalin

quotes.quote: I believe in one thing only, the power of the human will.
quotes.name: Stalin

quotes.quote: Freedom in capitalist society always remains about the same as it was in ancient Greek republics: Freedom for slave owners.
quotes.name: Lenin

quotes.quote: A lie told often enough becomes the truth.
quotes.name: Lenin

quotes.quote: The goal of socialism is communism.
quotes.name: Lenin

quotes.quote: The way to crush the bourgeoisie is to grind them between the millstones of taxation and inflation.
quotes.name: Lenin

quotes.quote: Give me four years to teach the children and the seed I have sown will never be uprooted.
quotes.name: Lenin

quotes.quote: There are no morals in politics; there is only expedience. A scoundrel may be of use to us just because he is a scoundrel.
quotes.name: Lenin

quotes.quote: Without a revolutionary theory there cannot be a revolutionary movement.
quotes.name: Lenin

quotes.quote: Communism is Soviet power plus the electrification of the whole country.
quotes.name: Lenin

quotes.quote: Under socialism all will govern in turn and will soon become accustomed to no one governing.
quotes.name: Lenin

quotes.quote: No amount of political freedom will satisfy the hungry masses.
quotes.name: Lenin

quotes.quote: If the freedom of speech is taken away then dumb and silent we may be led, like sheep to the slaughter.
quotes.name: George Washington

quotes.quote: I hope I shall possess firmness and virtue enough to maintain what I consider the most enviable of all titles, the character of an honest man.
quotes.name: George Washington

quotes.quote: Observe good faith and justice toward all nations. Cultivate peace and harmony with all.
quotes.name: George Washington

quotes.quote: Discipline is the soul of an army. It makes small numbers formidable; procures success to the weak, and esteem to all.
quotes.name: George Washington

quotes.quote: It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.
quotes.name: George Washington

quotes.quote: Liberty, when it begins to take root, is a plant of rapid growth.
quotes.name: George Washington

quotes.quote: Happiness and moral duty are inseparably connected.
quotes.name: George Washington

quotes.quote: Arbitrary power is most easily established on the ruins of liberty abused to licentiousness.
quotes.name: George Washington

quotes.quote: Worry is the interest paid by those who borrow trouble.
quotes.name: George Washington

quotes.quote: The basis of our political system is the right of the people to make and to alter their constitutions of government.
quotes.name: George Washington

quotes.quote: A people that values its privileges above its principles soon loses both.
quotes.name: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.quote: In preparing for battle I have always found that plans are useless, but planning is indispensable.
quotes.name: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.quote: I hate war as only a soldier who has lived it can, only as one who has seen its brutality, its futility, its stupidity.
quotes.name: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.quote: Leadership is the art of getting someone else to do something you want done because he wants to do it.
quotes.name: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.quote: May we never confuse honest dissent with disloyal subversion.
quotes.name: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.quote: Farming looks mighty easy when your plow is a pencil and you're a thousand miles from the corn field.
quotes.name: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.quote: Generally speaking, the Way of the warrior is resolute acceptance of death.
quotes.name: Miyamoto Musashi

quotes.quote: Perception is strong and sight weak. In strategy it is important to see distant things as if they were close and to take a distanced view of close things.
quotes.name: Miyamoto Musashi

quotes.quote: Perceive that which cannot be seen with the eye.
quotes.name: Miyamoto Musashi

quotes.quote: Do nothing which is of no use.
quotes.name: Miyamoto Musashi

quotes.quote: Study strategy over the years and achieve the spirit of the warrior. Today is victory over yourself of yesterday; tomorrow is your victory over lesser men.
quotes.name: Miyamoto Musashi
